resources.string: Customize status bar look and style
Life is colorful, don\'t be bored
Enables access to recovery and bootloader
Configure the way quick settings tiles are arranged
Show charging current, voltage, wattage and battery temperature on lockscreen while charging
Toggle the visibility of icons in statusbar
Show network speed in the status bar
Display custom date before the clock
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy
Hide and show clock at regular intervals of time
Show battery percentage in the QS header instead of battery estimate
Show battery indicator in the QS header instead of QS panel
Put the battery text on left of battery icon
Hide apps from appearing in recents
Turn off some pixels to reduce power consumption
Auto enable with battery saver to increase power savings

Smart Pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see a significant improvement in battery life. For a good user experience, we recommend setting the amount of disabled pixels to 75 percent while shifting every 10 minutes.
Allow legacy apps to use full screen
Applications need to be restarted after changes
Display media cover art when playing music
Unlock device with fingerprint directly after reboot or lockdown
Disable expanding quick settings on secure lockscreen
Display 4G icon in signal icon instead LTE
Show headers in the notification shade
Pulse does not work with some audio sources when listening on device speaker
Show graphic equalizer while music\'s playing
Animate each pulse bar more smoothly
Eliminate general interruptions during mobile game play
Add apps for automatic Gaming mode
Automatically enable/disable Gaming mode based on the usage of selected apps
Limit or disable Heads-up interruptions by notification type
Show only for incoming calls & alarms
Disable hardware buttons while Gaming mode is enabled
Prevent changes to screen brightness while Gaming mode is enabled
System will try to detect and add gaming apps automatically
Hide heads-up while using these applications
Disable heads-up related to these applications
Peeking notifications will show for %d seconds
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze heads up from that application for 1 minute
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze heads up from that application for %d minutes
Only show heads-up for incoming calls, texts and alarms
Display data usage summary in quick settings footer
Display Settings icon in quick settings footer
Display Running Services icon in quick settings footer
Display the tile edit icon in quick settings footer
Move volume panel to the left
Change volume buttons behaviour when rotating the device
Pressing the volume keys will wake your device
Light up the side edges of the screen on notification pulse
Show lights for all doze events and not just notifications
Show lights on Always On Display
Hide AOD content when lights are showing
Block system wakelocks to save battery
Blocking wakelocks has the potential to cause instability, crashes or data loss.
To see and block wakelocks, turn on wakelock blocker.
Block alarms while the screen is off to save battery
Blocking alarms have the potential to cause instability, crashes or data loss.
To see and block alarms, turn on alarm blocker.
Use old style mobile data icons
Use pre-Pie mobile icons for signal
Show custom logo in the status bar
Enable UI background blur (expensive for GPU renderer)
Color range to be used for the bar
Animate the battery bar when the device is plugged in
Use a custom color when the device is plugged in
Wake up the device if charger is plugged/unplugged
Avoid launching the app when tapping the heads-up notification
Hide smart replies to save screen space with peeking notifications
Generates colors based on your wallpaper
Show notifications ticker-style in status bar
Ticker is visible only when notification heads-up is not shown. Devices with center notch should hide cutout under User Interface settings or under Developer options.
Display lock icon on the lockscreen
Display status bar on the lockscreen
Selectively block apps from accessing certain battery draining sensors
Significant motion, accelerometer, linear acceleration sensors will be blocked for these apps
You are not limited to the pre-installed weather icon packages. Search the Google PlayStore with the keyword "chronus icons" and you will find a lot of additional packages.
Enable notification panel header weather display
Note\u003a you can install new icon packs from play store by searching for \"Chronus icons\"
Condition icon pack is used in quick settings and lock screen
Show current weather condition and temperature
Show name of current city on left of image
Show current city temperature on right of image
Instead of using the big widget, it\'ll show next to the date
Allow apps to bypass security systems by pretending to be a different app.
Force apps to ignore notch space
Please restart the application to apply the changes
Use default status bar height in Hide mode
Disable black fill-in for display cutout
Sometimes the change doesn\'t work instantly\nPlease restart SystemUI once if it happens
Use accent color for qs tile icons and background
Switch QS icon color to white or black if gradient tint enabled
Display a cross sign next to signal bar when data is disabled
Use icon button instead of text
Use fingerprint reader also when the screen is off
Show fingerprint icon when the screen is off
Turns on from sunset to a custom time
Turns on from a custom time to sunrise
Disable Wi-Fi when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Bluetooth when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Mobile data when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Location when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Sensors when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Always on display when Sleep mode is turned on
Enable Aggressive idle and standby when Sleep mode is turned on
Sleep mode allows you to disable certain services to help save battery and silence your phone while you sleep.
These are power saving features. They may interfere with services intended to run at idle, like navigation apps. You can whitelist these apps from being affected in the app battery settings.
Enter device idle more frequently and wake up less
Restrict apps from running the background
Enable Aggressive Battery automatically when using battery saver
Set media artwork as notification media background
